column1: Aïn Témouchent is a city in north western Algeria;(Arabic: عين تموشنت‎)) it is the capital of Aïn Témouchent Province.  Ain Temouchent is located 72 km south-west of Oran
column2: a city with which it is closely associated
column3: and 63 km west of Sidi Bel Abbes. Known as "la Florissante"
column4: it is set in a narrow fertile basaltic valley amid vineyards and orchards.

column1: The town was founded  in 1851 by Spanish immigrants
column2: who built on what had been the site of Roman Albulae and Arab Ksar ibn Senar.
